docs.text: alchemy is steeped in shades of blue .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kieslowski's blue , that is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with its examination of death , isolation , character restoration , and recovery from loss , suzanne myers' new independent film echoes the polish director's internationally-acclaimed 1993 release .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: language aside , the principal difference between the films is that , while kieslowski took great pains to draw us into the main character's world , alchemy keeps its viewers at arm's length .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as a result , while we're able to appreciate the film's intellectual tapestry , it is emotionally distant .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: alchemy is divided into three chapters : " charity " , " faith " , and " hope " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while there are common themes and story elements running through all three , the single constant is the main character , a sculptor/russian translator named louisa ( rya kihlstedt ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when the film opens , she's living with her painter boyfriend , whom she believes to be cheating on her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: following his sudden death in an automobile accident , louisa's life is thrown into turmoil .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: events swirls around her , and she can't find a source of stability .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in her quest to make sense out of her loss , she befriends her late boyfriend's mistress , visits her ill sister , and , eventually , abandons her old life by joining a " back-to- nature " cult .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: alchemy successfully explores a variety of compelling issues .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in addition to asking the basic question of how a person should cope with the unexpected death of a loved one , it probes beneath the surface of concepts like the importance of faith in the healing process , the meaning of love , and the nature of art .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: does personality restoration come through interacting with others or escaping from the familiar ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: are artistic epiphanies the result of focused solitude or of living life , with all of its various distractions , to the fullest ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: myers' challenge is to make these subjects , art film staples , engrossing in a new context .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: through louisa's struggles , she succeeds .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while alchemy isn't always emotionally appealing , it never loses its fascination .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even when we're not connecting with louisa , who is often more of a locus for ideas than a fully-developed personality , there's enough material on-screen to hold our attention .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the cinematography is stunning .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: city scenes are tinted with blue , adding a cold , bleak dimension to the film's early portions .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: later , when louisa reaches the " wilderness " , we're treated to a dazzling array of autumnal splendor -- brightly-colored leaves in the trees and on the ground .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a startling-but-effective visual contrast that emphasizes the changes taking place in louisa's life as she travels the road back to emotional stability .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the title refers to the practice of a group of mystical faith- healers who use " alchemy " to provide for the needs of the body and soul .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and , although louisa partakes of their peculiar brand of medicine , it's ultimately love and companionship , not alchemy , that brings solace .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: her pain is assuaged only when she lets go of the belief that the inherent safety of being alone is life's ultimate goal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even though louisa's final transformation lacks the impact it could have possessed had she been a more vital character , it's still an intriguing and enlightening process to watch .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: alchemy isn't pure magic , but , especially during its best moments , it's close .
docs.label: positive
